intro: Pentapanax larium, commonly known as the Chinese five-leaf plant, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries like China, Vietnam, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its distinctive five-lobed leaves, which are often arranged in a whorled pattern. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. The botanical features of Pentapanax larium make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and pharmacological research.
